    • Method Detail

      • reverseLexicalIntArray

        public static java.util.Comparator<int[]> reverseLexicalIntArray()
        Returns a comparator for int arrays that compares arrays in reverse lexicographical order, which compares elements from the last index backward (e.g. [1,2,3] is after [1,3,2]). If arrays are of different length, the shorter array comes first.
        See Also:
        lexicalIntArray()

      • lexicalIntArray

        public static java.util.Comparator<int[]> lexicalIntArray()
        Returns a comparator for int arrays that compares arrays in lexicographical (aka "dictionary") order (e.g. [1,2,3] is before [1,3,2]). If arrays are of different length, the shorter array comes first.
        See Also:
        reverseLexicalIntArray()

      • fromCollection

        @Nullable
public static <T> java.util.Comparator<? super T> fromCollection(java.util.Collection<? extends T> collection)
        Returns comparator used by collection. SortedSet returns SortedSet.comparator(), else returns null.
